guidelines.title: Code Of Conduct
guidelines.description: This guideline outlines the expected behavior from all contributors to ensure a respectful and inclusive project environment.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Contributors should follow the provided template and guidelines when reporting issues to ensure clarity and consistency.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: This guideline describes how to properly submit pull requests, including necessary checks, descriptions, and adherence to coding standards.

guidelines.title: Branching Model
guidelines.description: Contributors are advised to follow the specific branching model outlined in the document to maintain orderly and manageable codebase.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Describes the format and content expectations for commit messages to ensure clear and informative changes in the project's history.

guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Contributors are expected to adhere to the defined code style guidelines to maintain consistency and readability across the codebase.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: Outlines the review process that pull requests undergo, including who reviews them and how feedback should be addressed.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: This guideline emphasizes the importance of writing and running tests to ensure new contributions do not introduce bugs.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Encourages contributors to update or create documentation as necessary when making changes to ensure the project stays well-documented.

guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Developers must adhere to the project's coding style to maintain consistency across the codebase. This guideline is crucial for readability and easier maintenance of the project.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Contributions should include tests to ensure new features or bug fixes do not break existing functionality. This helps in maintaining the quality and reliability of the project.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: When reporting issues, provide detailed information, including steps to reproduce the bug, expected behavior, and screenshots if applicable. Good issue reporting helps developers understand and address problems more efficiently.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: When submitting pull requests, include a clear description of the changes and reference any related issues. This process ensures that the maintainers understand the purpose and scope of the changes.

guidelines.title: Branch Naming
guidelines.description: Use descriptive branch names that reflect the feature or fix being implemented. Clear naming conventions help in managing and reviewing changes.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write meaningful commit messages that describe the changes made. Good commit messages are essential for tracking the history and context of changes.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Update documentation to reflect any changes made in the codebase. Accurate documentation helps users and other developers understand how to use and contribute to the project.

guidelines.title: Code Reviews
guidelines.description: Participate in code reviews to provide feedback and suggestions. Code reviews are a collaborative practice that improves code quality and knowledge sharing.

guidelines.title: Community Engagement
guidelines.description: Actively engage with the community through discussions, issue comments, and pull requests. This engagement fosters a collaborative environment and helps grow the project.
